text.string: ErgoActive will help computer users stay healthy while using a computer.
The navigation pane on the left can be used to view information and tips on how to stay fit while using a computer.
ErgoActive also monitors you keyboard activity and will unobtrusively remind you to take a break. Taking regular breaks has been proven to reduce the risk of Carpal Tunnel Syndrome and RSI.
After how many minutes of computer usage would you like to take a break:

text.string: hand stretch
close and open each hand a few times
wrist stretch
place your palms together and push left hand backward with right hand, do the same with right hand, repeat five to six times
arm stretch
put your hands together behind your back push backwards count to five and repeat a couple of times
neck stretch
place your left hand on the right side of your head pull very gently with almost no force hold for a couple of seconds stretch opposite direction using your other arm repeat a couple of times
shoulder stretch
put your hands on each shoulder try to keep upper arms as vertical as possible roll your elbows in a circular movement
body stretch
put you hands together and gently stretch your arms over your head try to reach high as possible
back stretch
gently lean forward in your chair and reach your toeshold position for a couple of seconds repeat a couple of times
upper arm stretch
with left arm reach for your opposite shoulder use your right arm to grab left elbow pull gently and hold for a few seconds repeat with opposite arm
leg stretch
place left leg over the right leg grab your left knee and pull with right arm to stretch your hamstring repeat with your other leg
foot stretch
lift your left leg and roll your foot clockwise five times in a circular movement, repeat counter clock wise repeat with the opposite leg
